censuses</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social and occupational mobility - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The 2001 <i>Individual Licenced Sample of Anonymised Records for Imputation Analysis</i> (I-SAR) is a 3% sample of individuals for all countries of the United Kingdom, with approximately 1.84 million records. The data are available for England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland. Information is included for each individual on the main demographic, health, socio-economic and household variables. The 3% sample is an increase by comparison with 2% in 1991. Some variables have been broad-banded to reduce disclosure risk. The lowest level of geography is the Government Office Region (GOR), although Inner and Outer London are separately identified. This represents a significant reduction by comparison with the 1991 where large Local Authorities (population 120,000 and over) were separately identified.<br> <br> This dataset contains 173 variables, including 84 imputation flag variables. The standard version, containing 89 I-SAR variables, is available under SN 7205.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The dataset includes information on age, gender, ethnicity, health, employment status, housing, amenities, family type, geography, social class, education, distance to work, workplace, hours worked and migration. In addition, the ONS have added occupational coding, not available in the Census tables, for individuals aged 16-65 who last worked more than 5 years ago but less than ten years ago and for those aged 65-74 who were not currently working at the Census but who had worked in the previous ten years. A further 84 imputation flag variables are also included.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="single" date="2001-01-01T00:00:00Z">2001</timePrd>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>3% sample of individuals enumerated in households and communal establishments in the 2001 Census.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>The 2001 SARs were sampled from the One Number Census (ONC) database for the entire UK. Thus individuals and households imputed as part of the ONC are included in the SARs.</sampProc>         <deviat>1,843,525 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service Census support</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>UK: standard conditions; non-UK: depositor permission</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.<br>Additional special conditions of use also apply. See terms and conditions for further information.<p>In addition, the UK Data Service is required to request permission from the depositor prior to supplying the data to non-UK residents.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>7205 Census 2001: Individual Licenced Sample of Anonymised Records (I-SAR) </relStdy>       <relStdy>7207 Census 2001: Small Area Microdata (SAM)  </relStdy>       <relStdy>7208 Census 2001: Small Area Microdata for Imputation Analysis (SAM) </relStdy>       <relStdy>7209 Census 2001: Controlled Access Microdata Sample Test File (CAMS) </relStdy>       <relStdy>5278 2001 Census: Special Licence Household Sample of Anonymised Records (SL-HSAR) </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
